reviewText: This is no Bonanza!I bought this box set of the limited adventure show, Hart of the West. It started both Beau and Lloyd Bridges.The one joke idea of a man  buying a ranch after a mid life crisis is not fleshed out in these  fifteen episodes, The towns people seem this side of Northern Exposure and they don't workBennet Pomerantz, AUDIOWORLD
Title: Harts of the West -  The Complete Collection

reviewText: I bought this set because I like Sean Murray (again with the NCIS connection).I don't remember if I actually had access to this series when it aired.Anyway, the second episode was a delightful surprise when Mark Harmon shows up as the guest star (a red-headed rodeo clown!). So much of M.H. in his characters - and so much not!  Builds a table out of an old barn door -- scene fixing the roof reminiscent of Mexico (for NCIS fans).Other episodes are also enjoyable (haven't finished watching all of them).Fun to watch Lloyd and Beau Bridges together.  Dale Robertson is also great to watch.A nice combination of serious subjects and fun.Oh, yeah, and Sean is good!  Fun to watch him as a teen and in a character more like DiNozzio than McGee!
Title: Harts of the West -  The Complete Collection

reviewText: This is a delightful, funny tv show. Too bad there were not more seasons. It is wonderful to watch a show with no cursing, sex & the usual crap that is on most tv shows today.  Beau Bridges & his father are hilarious. I love Harley Jane Kozak & their son chasing the older woman is so funny without being crude.  I think this show would have run for years but it was up against such great competition then.
Title: Harts of the West -  The Complete Collection

reviewText: Television programs have moved on to edgier topics these days, some of which are quite well done and worth watching, but Harts of the West exemplifies what is lacking. If you're tired of grimacing at shock-value and would rather find yourself smiling, here are 15 evenings sure to lift your spirit. Beau Bridges plays Dave Hart, who after suffering a mild heart attack decides he's had enough grimacing and wishes to lighten up by moving his reluctant family to the present day western frontier. The stories are lighthearted and simple, and the tone is laid back. It is a testimony to the strength and importance of family.The transfer to DVD is excellent, both visually and audibly, and a steal at this price.
summary: Charming, warm, clean, funny, and smart
Title: Harts of the West -  The Complete Collection

reviewText: This 3 disc DVD set contains 15 episodes from the short lived TV series `Harts of the West", the quality is fine and each disc is enclosed with its' own case and episode descriptions.Many character actors are guest stars. There are just a few that are well known now; Diane Ladd, Mark Harmon as a drunken rodeo clown and a young  Sean Murray plays one of the sons of Beau Bridges.Beaus' character is a former salesman, who after a heart attack decides to move his family west and purchase a run down ranch from an ex- con man played by Beaus' father, Lloyd Bridges. These two actors alone are reason to purchase the set, as they are always a delight to watch perform their craft.The 15 episodes are a relaxing pleasure to watch- just a simple TV series for good entertainment.
Title: Harts of the West -  The Complete Collection
